name: rancor

procedures: T1053.005::[Rancor] launched a scheduled task to gain persistence using the schtasks /create /sc command.
T1059.003::[Rancor] has used cmd.exe to execute commmands.
T1059.005::[Rancor] has used VBS scripts as well as embedded macros for execution.
T1071.001::[Rancor] has used HTTP for C2.
T1105::[Rancor] has downloaded additional malware, including by using [certutil].
T1204.002::[Rancor] attempted to get users to click on an embedded macro within a Microsoft Office Excel document to launch their malware.
T1218.007::[Rancor] has used msiexec to download and execute malicious installer files over HTTP.
T1566.001::[Rancor] has attached a malicious document to an email to gain initial access.

description: [Rancor](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0075) is a threat group that has led targeted campaigns against the South East Asia region. [Rancor](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0075) uses politically-motivated lures to entice victims to open malicious documents. (Citation: Rancor Unit42 June 2018)
